newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Manhattan Card mandates HK$400 mln FRCD.
newsitem.headline: Manhattan Card mandates HK$400 mln FRCD.

text.p: Manhattan Card Co Ltd has mandated three banks to arrange a HK$400 million floating rate certificate of deposit issue, bankers said.
They said the issue has a maturity of five years with a put and a call option in year three. It pays a coupon of 45 basis points over the three-month Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rate.
The mandated arrangers are Chase Manhattan Asia, JP Morgan Securities Asia and Schroders Asia.
The issuer completed a HK$650 million FRCD issue in September 1995.

That five-year facility had a put and a call option in years three and four, and paid 60 basis points over the three-month Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rate. With fees, the all-in return was 70 basis points.
